name: tap water production, conventional treatment | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21820/documentation

This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of conventional treatment for production tap water. Conventional treatment includes coagulation and decantation, filtration and disinfection. Other treatment such as oxidation (ultraviolet radiation, ozone) and other adjustment (pH, alkalinity, etc.)  can be present in some plant. Inventory was constructed from reported chemicals, energy inputs and wastes from 52 treatment plants in various parts of the country

This activity starts from tap water, under pressure, at tap water treatment plant and fed into tap water distribution network.

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping and treatment system, as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. It includes all chemicals and material added to the water during treatment. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network as they are included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is set from 2010  to the year 2017 as it is a considering period in which conventional treatment plants have not passed through drastic technological changes.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from data from 52 conventional treatment plants in India. The uncertainty was adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Most Frequent technology in tap water production facility in India
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From 52 conventional tap water production facilities to all conventional facility in India.Conventional treatment accounts for 81.5% of the total produced tap water in Inida. Data was used for regionalizing chemicals, the remaining exchanges were copied from the global dataset.The uncertainty has been changed accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Based on data collected from 52 conventional treatment plants representing 3.6% of the total produced tap water in India. Conventional tap production facilities were regionalized in accordance to the "Status of Water Treatment Plants in India” (Pollution & Board, 2010) report. Retrieved from: http://cpcb.nic.in/upload/NewItems/NewItem_103_statusofwaterqualitypackage.pdf
The remaining flow for energy consumption and chemicals used were copied from the reference process from Quebec, as they were also considered adequate for this dataset

exchanges.description: Measured value  taken from the "tap water production, conventional treatment, GLO" dataset (accessed 20170920) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. Average use of liquid oxygen for onsite ozone production in surveyed conventional treatment plants. Note than only 2 plants over the 9 conventional plants reported using this substance. Plants not reporting this consumable were attributed an input value of 0 during the calculation of the weighted average.

exchanges.description: Calculated value taken from the "tap water production, conventional treatment, GLO" dataset (accessed 20170920) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. Amount of water works construction attributed to the production of 1kg of tap water. Value is based on assumed lifetime production of water treatment plant and an assumed typical medium-sized plant of 30,000 m3/day.

Amount of sand to compensate losses through sand filter washing. Extrapolated to all plant from one reported value. Also includes average use of micro-sand for adjustment for this technology. Note that only 1 of the 9 conventional plants reported using micro-sand. Plants not reporting this consumable were attributed an input value of 0 during the calculation of the weighted average.
